text: وانه لذكر لك ولقومك وسوف تسـلون

translations.translation: It is certainly a reminder to you and to your people and you will be questioned.
It is a (source) of greatness for you and your people. You will surely be questioned about it.
Verily it is a great source of eminence for you and your people, and soon you will be called to account concerning that.
The Quran is a reminder to you and to your people and you will soon be questioned about it.
And it is undoubtedly an honour for you and your people; and you will soon be questioned.
And verily, this is indeed a Dhikr for you and your people, and you will be questioned.
And most surely it is a reminder for you and your people, and you shall soon be questioned.
Surely it is a Reminder to thee and to thy people; and assuredly you will be questioned.
And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and ye will be questioned.
it is certainly a reminder to you and to your people and you will soon be  called to account.
And verily it is an admonition Unto thee and thy people; and presently ye will be questioned.
Indeed it is a reminder for you and your people, and soon you will be questioned.
The (Qur'an) is indeed the message, for thee and for thy people; and soon shall ye (all) be brought to account.
And verily, this (the Quran) is indeed a Reminder for you (O Muhammad SAW) and your people (Quraish people, or your followers), and you will be questioned (about it).
It is indeed a Reminder to you and to your nation, and without doubt you shall be questioned.
It is a message for you, and for your people; and you will be questioned.
And indeed, it is a remembrance for you and your people, and you [all] are going to be questioned.

[43:44]   And it is indeed a Reminder, an honour, for you and for your people, as it has been revealed in their language. And you will [eventually] be questioned, about [the extent of] your fulfilling your duty towards it.

(And lo!) i.e. the Qur'an (is in truth a Reminder for thee) an honour for you (and for thy folk) the Quraysh because it is revealed in their own language; (and ye will be questioned) about the gratitude which is owed to such an honour.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { وَإِنَّهُ لَذِكْرٌ لَّكَ وَلِقَوْمِكَ } معناه شَرفٌ
 وهو أنْ يَقولَ الرّجلُ أنا من العَربِ، فيقال من أي العَربِ، فيقول مِن قُريش، فيكون يَملكُ منها الشَّرفُ في الدّنيا

translations.translation:
And His saying, "Indeed, it is a reminder for you and your people" - this is an honor.


And the man says, "I am from the Arabs," and they say, "Which Arabs?," and he says, "From the Quraysh," and he has honor from them in the world.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ وَإِنَّهُ } أي: القرآن { لَذِكْرٌ } أي: عظة وتذكير { لَّكَ وَلِقَوْمِكَ } فعليكم أن تتعظوا به
 وبما فيه من الحِكم والأحكام
 والعبر والرموز والإشارات { وَسَوْفَ تُسْأَلُونَ } [الزخرف: 44] عن قيامكم بها وامتثالكم بما فيها


وإن عاند المشركين معك
 واستهزءوا بك وبكتابك
 ونسبوا دينك إلى البدعة والاختلاق
 فـ
[النحل: 127] وينسبونك إليه
 { وَسْئَلْ مَنْ أَرْسَلْنَا مِن قَبْلِكَ مِن رُّسُلِنَآ } أي: أحبار قومهم وعلماء دينهم

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ وإِنه } أي: ما أُوحي إليك { لَذِكرّ } لشرف عظيم { لك ولقومك } ولأمتك، أو: لقومك من قريش، فما زال العز فيهم، والشرف لهم، من زمانه صلى الله عليه وسلم إلى قرب الساعة
 قال صلى الله عليه وسلم:

 " لا يزال هذا الشأن في قريش ما بقيّ منه اثنان "
